content_blocks.title: FASTER Focus

content.text: FASTER your environment optimisation practice. Forget messy defaults, activate by scanning your physical and mental workspace, visualise a tidy Kali console, teach forward with a quick note to future you, enter by launching the connectivity health-check alias, and review when your shutdown script prompts a debrief.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Prime your mindset before touching configuration files.
memory_aids: Forget → Active → State → Teach → Enter → Review
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Operators who prep their state before logging in reduce mistakes and reclaim time.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: What tiny ritual will keep you in a high-performance state before each session?

content_blocks.title: Key Moves

content.text:
## Execution Checklist
- **Lock in a reliable Kali snapshot baseline**
- **Script VPN and lab connectivity checks with logging**
- **Segment workspace folders for recon, exploits, loot, and reports**

Use this briefing before adjusting packages or networking settings.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Keep this checklist nearby whenever you update the workstation.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Consultants maintain written baselines so they can recover from broken updates quickly.

content_blocks.title: Scenario Lab

content.text:
### Lab Goal: Harden and streamline your Kali workspace for offensive labs
1. Create ~/offsec with subfolders for recon, exploits, loot, and reports.
2. Write an alias that runs apt updates, pings lab gateways, and stores results in a dated log.
3. Configure proxychains.conf to support both TOR and SOCKS-based pivoting.
4. Capture a short terminal recording walking through your setup decisions.

Capture artefacts as you go so the reporting section writes itself.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Execute the plan, gather proof, and share the improvements.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Red-team workstations are audited regularly; recorded walkthroughs make peer reviews faster.

content_blocks.title: Teach-Back Debrief

content.text:
Teach it back: record a two-minute voice note explaining how you optimised the workstation.
Answer the prompts:
- What signal told you the environment was ready?
- How will you elevate your state faster before the next session?
- Who will you debrief using the control-room tour analogy?

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Closing the loop by teaching forward embeds the workflow in long-term memory.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: High-performing teams document environment changes so anyone can rebuild them under pressure.
